channel.title: Trouble with Trig Identities
channel.description:
I'm doing homework on this section and I got stuck on the following problems:
Match the trigonometric expression with one of the following 1.) The answer is sec[sup]2[/sup] x + tan[sup]2[/sup] x.
sec[sup]4[/sup] x - tan[sup]4[/sup] x
2.) The answer is sec[sup]2[/sup] x.
[u] sec[sup]2[/sup] x - 1 [/u] sin[sup]2[/sup] x
Use the fundamental identities to simplify the expression. [u] cos[sup]2[/sup] y [/u] 1 - sin y
Help is appreciated please.

item.title: Trouble with Trig Identities
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well, I’ll go for the first one then.

sec[sup]4[/sup] x - tan[sup]4[/sup] x

1 - sin[sup]4[/sup] x
cos[sup]4[/sup] x cos[sup]4[/sup] x

1 - sin[sup]4[/sup] x
cos[sup]4[/sup] x

(1 - sin[sup]2[/sup] x)(1 + sin[sup]2[/sup] x)
cos[sup]4[/sup] x

(cos[sup]2[/sup] x)(1 + sin[sup]2[/sup] x)
cos[sup]4[/sup] x

1 + sin[sup]2[/sup] x
cos[sup]2[/sup] x

1 + sin[sup]2[/sup] x
cos[sup]2[/sup] x cos[sup]2[/sup] x

sec[sup]2[/sup] x + tan[sup]2[/sup] x

Edit: Wow, I just realized that’s a totally long-winded way of doing it.

sec[sup]4[/sup] x - tan[sup]4[/sup] x

(sec[sup]2[/sup] x + tan[sup]2[/sup] x)(sec[sup]2[/sup] x - tan[sup]2[/sup] x)

Using the extended Pythagorean Identities, we know that tan[sup]2[/sup] x + 1 = sec[sup]2[/sup] x and thus sec[sup]2[/sup] x - tan[sup]2[/sup] x = 1

(sec[sup]2[/sup] x + tan[sup]2[/sup] x)(1)

sec[sup]2[/sup] x + tan[sup]2[/sup] x

item.title: Trouble with Trig Identities
item.dc:creator: @cartooncows89 cartooncows89
item.description:
@cartooncows89 wrote:

sec[sup]2[/sup] x - 1
sin[sup]2[/sup] x

I was able to figure this out

This -> sec[sup]2[/sup] x - 1 = tan[sup]2[/sup] x tan[sup]2[/sup] x= sec[sup]2[/sup] x - 1
sin[sup]2[/sup] x sin[sup]2[/sup] x

You then change the tangent into sin[sup]2[/sup] x
cos[sup]2[/sup] x

Which you will multiply by the 1 sin[sup]2[/sup] x * 1
sin[sup]2[/sup] x cos[sup]2[/sup] x * sin[sup]2[/sup] x

The sin[sup]2[/sup] x will then cancel each other out leaving 1
cos[sup]2[/sup] x

This then equals sec[sup]2[/sup] x
